text:
72 yo female w/ PMH CAD, MI, HTN, PVD who presented to OSH w/ severe
   chest pain [**2188-10-28**]. Described pain as "tightness" in center of her
   chest "12"/10 on pain scale and just like pain she had with her heart
   attack in [**2185**].  +Associated N/V/SOB. OSH found her w/ +trop of 7.08
   and EKG w/ ST depressions V3-V6. Started on IV nitro/ Heparin/
   integrilin. CXR w/ pulm congestion- diuresed w/ lasix. Transferred to
   [**Hospital1 19**]  [**Hospital Ward Name 289**] 3 on [**10-29**] for planned cath [**10-30**].
   Pt stable on floor on above drips until 1900 when she triggered for
   chest pain/ tachycardia/hypotension. Managed on floor for several hours
   w/ constant chest pain varying in severity from [**12-27**] to [**4-26**]. Given
   500ml IVF bolus for BP support in order for IV nitro to be given.  Pt
   triggered 2nd time w/ chest pain and acute pulm edema, ?ST segment
   changes. IV nitro able to be turned back on and 40mg IV lasix given.
   Sent to CCU on NRB mask, tachypneic on arrival w/ good O2sat 100%,
   SBP>100, HR 100s.  Chest pain free on arrival. Slowly weaned to 4L NC
   w/ SPO2 >93%. Pt
s RR decreased to low-mid 20
s and reported feeling
   much more comfortable and able to sleep. AM labs, MRSA screen, UA/C&S
   done.  FS done= 429- see below. Has been running hyperglycemic since on
   prednisone which she has been given for DYE/ IODINE ALLERGY.
   Myocardial infarction, acute (AMI, STEMI, NSTEMI)
   Assessment:
   Chest pain free since arrival to CCU on IV heparin/ integrillin/
   nitroglycerin. BP 85-100s/40s-50s. HR 85-100s ST w/ frequent
   PVCs/bigem. Cardiac enzymes
   Action:
   Response:
   Plan:
   NPO for cardiac cath. Needs prednisone/ benadryl on call to cath lab
   for DYE ALLERGY. Continue to trend cardiac enzymes. Cont current drips
   to cath lab. Next PTT due 10:00. Assess for CP. Daily EKG.
   Pulmonary edema
   Assessment:
   LS rales
 up bilaterally w/ expiratory wheezes throughout.
   O2requirement of 4LNC. Trace LE edema. RR 30s on arrival to CCU.
   Action:
   40mg IV lasix given on [**Hospital Ward Name 289**] 3 prior to arrival to CCU. Monitored
   effects.
   Response:
   250ml Urine out within 1 hour after lasix dose. Continue to make good
   UOP after.
   Plan:
   Daily CXR, freq resp assessment/lung exam. Monitor SPO2.
   Hyperglycemia
   Assessment:
   FS 300s-400s since admission to [**Hospital1 19**] presumably from PO prednisone as
   pt usually well-controlled per report.
   Action:
   Team alerted of high blood sugars. Covered w/ 12units humalog for FS of
   429 at 0400.
   Response:
   Repeat FS=
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor glucose closely.
   Ineffective Coping
   Assessment:
   Pt w/ multiple current life stressors including husband who is in rehab
   for CHF, son who is battling IV drug addiction, recently assumed  full
   custody of son
s 2 teenage boys (17yo and 19yo), and is primary
   caretaker of sister who has recently been diagnosed w/ dementia. Pt
   able to verbalize feelings of despair and helplessness.
   Action:
   Emotional support provided. Reinforced that pt needs to take care of
   herself first, especially now. Social work consult ordered for AM.
   Response:
   Pt still concerned re: family issues.
   Plan:
   SW consult as soon as possible before or after procedure for additional
   supports. Could benefit from out-pt supports as well.
   Tobacco use, current
   Assessment:
   Pt w/ significant smoking history and currently smokes 1.5 packs/week
   which is decrease for her. Had quit for a while but in light of recent
   stressors has started again. Also, sister is a smoker and she spends a
   lot of time with her. Pt aware of health concerns re: smoking
   especially to the CV system.
   Action:
   Smoking cessation counseling. SW consult ordered for issues above.
   Response:
   Understands dangers of smoking to health. Needs reinforcement.
   Plan:
   Reinforce current teaching.
